translated: Birth Stories
The Four-Collection
The Lesser Quail Chapter
The Birth Story of the Deity (in the Form of a Quail)
“He kills with his hands and feet,
and smears his mouth with blood;
He is dear to the King,
whom do you think he is?”
“He abuses as he likes,
and desires his master’s wife;
He is dear to the King,
whom do you think he is?”
“He slanders with untruth,
and accuses with what is false;
He is dear to the King,
whom do you think he is?”
“He steals food and drink,
and clothes and bedding;
Stealing from others, they are,
they are dear to the King,

analyzed: kam tena tvā abhipassasi iti  devatā pañha jātakam dasama
translated: whom do you think he is?”🔽The Birth Story of the Deity (in the Form of a Quail) is the tenth.
The Lesser Quail Chapter is the fifth.
The summary:
The best of men, the best of lions,
the best of the Nīla path, and again,
the best of the Rasā copper-peak,
and the forest charioteer kills ten.
Then the chapter summary:🔽The Kāliṅga, the Pucimanda,🔽the house-polluter, the cuckoo,
that is the Lesser Quail Chapter,
the fifth is well-proclaimed.”
The Catukkanipāta is finished.
